summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
Specifies the video mode of operation for a video device.

member.name: VideoControlFlags.VideoControlFlag_FlipHorizontal
member.summary: Specifies that the picture is flipped horizontally.

member.name: VideoControlFlags.VideoControlFlag_FlipVertical
member.summary: Specifies that the picture is flipped vertically.

member.name: VideoControlFlags.VideoControlFlag_ExternalTriggerEnable
member.summary: Sets up a stream to capture a trigger from an external source, for example, a push button on a camera. Buffers can be queued to the driver but will not be passed up from the WDM capture driver (for compression, display, or writing to a file) until the external event happens. See Remarks.

member.name: VideoControlFlags.VideoControlFlag_Trigger
member.summary: In software, simulates an external trigger when the stream has the VideoControlFlag_ExternalTriggerEnable flag set.
